intro: Cryptantha flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has hairy, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Cryptantha flaccida is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks.
